adaptability.value:

n.支撑物；支柱；支持力量： thing or person that supports or reinforces
n.扶壁；撑墙；扶垛：a structure, usually brick or stone, built against a wall for support or reinforcement
【注】在填空考试中，经常考到的是第一个释义，而在阅读中，有时会出现flying buttress，意思是：拱扶垛。也就是一种硅石砌体构筑物，通常由桥墩或偏离主要结构并通过拱门与其相连的拱壁组成，沿着拱门可从拱形圆顶产生推力。但建议考生在备考时可以查一下该词的图例，比如牛津大学高阶字典等。
【考】buttressed

culprit.value: n. 被控犯罪的人；罪犯；刑事被告： one charged with an offense or crime.one guilty of a fault or crime

cultivate.value:
v. 结交(朋友)；建立(友谊) ：to seek the acquaintance or goodwill of; make friends with
v. 培养，养育：to nurture; foster
v. 培育，栽培：to foster the growth of

customary.value:
adj. 习惯上的；独特的；典型的：commonly practiced, used, or encountered; usual
adj. 习俗的；习惯的：based on custom or tradition rather than written law or contract

debilitate.value:
v. 使衰弱；削弱…的力量: to sap the strength or energy of; enervate
【派】debilitating  adj. 虚弱的

decelerate.value:
v. 使减速，降低...的速度: to decrease the velocity of
v. (通货膨胀、经济增长等的速度)减缓，放慢: when the rate of something such as inflation or economic growth decelerates, it slows down
【派】deceleration  n. 减速，下降
【考】decelerated

decimate.value:
v. 大批杀死；大量毁灭: to destroy or kill a large part of (a group)
v. 严重削弱，大幅缩减(系统或机构): to decimate a system or organization means to reduce its size and effectiveness greatly
【派】decimation  n. 多数人的杀害；大量毁灭
【考】decimated

decipher.value:
v. 译解；解释: decode; to read or interpret (ambiguous, obscure, or illegible matter)
【注】cipher  n. 密码

deduction.value:
n. 推论；推断: a deduction is a conclusion that you have reached about something because of other things that you know to be true
n. 扣除；减除: deduction is the act or process of subtracting an amount of money from a total amount
【考】deductions

defeat.value:
v. 击败；战胜: if you defeat someone, you win a victory over them in a battle, game, or contest
v.否决(提案或动议): if a proposal or motion in a debate is defeated, more people vote against it than for it
v.(任务或问题)难住，难倒: if a task or a problem defeats you, it is so difficult that you cannot do it or solve it

defect.value:
n. 缺点，欠缺: an imperfection that causes inadequacy or failure; a shortcoming
n. 瑕疵，毛病：the lack of something necessary or desirable for completion or perfection; deficiency
v.背叛： to abandon a position or an association, often to join an opposing group
【注】和deflect倾斜区分开来。

defense.value:
n. 保护；防卫手段：a means or method of defending or protecting
n. 辩护: an argument in support or justification of something

defiance.value:
n. 违抗；蔑视；挑战：the act or an example of defying; bold resistance to an opposing force or authority
n. 违抗（某人）；无视 (规定、法律等)：if you do something in defiance of a person, rule, or law, you do it even though you know that you are not allowed to do it

degrade.value:
v. 使丢脸；有辱…的人格；降低…的身份：to lower in dignity; dishonor or disgrace
v. 降低…价值: to reduce in worth or value
v. 降解: to reduce the complexity of (a chemical compound): decompose

delegate.value:

adj. 民主的；民主主义的：of, characterized by, or advocating democracy
adj. 大众的：of or for the people in general; popular

depart.value:

v. 背离；违背：to vary, as from a regular course; deviate
【注】考生要注意区分depart from 和depart for，例1：In the morning Mr McDonald departed for Sydney. 麦克唐纳先生上午启程前往悉尼。例2：Our tour departs from Heathrow Airport on 31 March and returns 16 April. 我们这次旅行于 3月 31 号从希思罗机场出发，4 月 16 号返回。

【考】deprived

prep. 虽然，尽管：in spite of; notwithstanding
n. 憎恨；怨恨：spite; malice

deterrent.value: n. 威慑力量；威慑因素；遏制物：something that prevents people from doing something by making them afraid of what will happen to them if they do it.

deviate.value: v. 背离, 偏离：to depart, as from a norm, a purpose, or a subject; stray

dismiss.value:

v. 不重视，不考虑：if you dismiss something, you decide or say that it is not important enough for you to think about or consider
v. 解雇；免…的职；开除：to end the employment or service of; discharge
【注】考生要注意该词或者该词的名词形式：dismissal在考试中的搭配dismiss…as…；dismissal…as…,意为，把…当作…而不予考虑或重视。例如：Mr. Wakeham dismissed the reports as speculation. 韦克厄姆先生把这些报道当作臆测而不予考虑。Gill's dismissal of the book as '386 pages of rubbish' 吉尔认为该书不过是386页的垃圾
